alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 13 at 1:23PM PST until January 17 at 4:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to six inches possible. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be too high for snow accumulations with the storm system Saturday night, but another storm system with colder air will bring the potential for accumulating snow to the San Diego Mountains Sunday night into Monday. Snow levels could drop as low as 4500 feet during that timeframe with the potential for up to six inches of snow. There will also be the potential for strong winds in the mountains during that time.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
